Shipment.title: Shipment
Shipment.description: Represents a shipment record with details such as order ID, customer information, tracking details, and status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the shipment record. This ID is generated by concatenating the Source Store Order ID and Item Name.

sourceStoreOrderId.description: The order ID from the source store.

itemName.description: The name of the item being shipped.

customerName.description: The name of the customer who placed the order.

orderDate.description: The date when the order was placed.

courier.description: The name of the courier company handling the shipment.

trackingNo.description: The tracking number assigned to the shipment.

trackingLink.description: A URL to track the shipment's progress on the courier's website.

status.description: The current status of the shipment (e.g., 'Delivered', 'In Transit', 'Pending').

Inbound.title: Inbound Shipment
Inbound.description: Represents an inbound shipment record, such as stock from a supplier.

id.description: Unique identifier for the inbound record, typically the client's order ID.

clientId.description: The client's unique order ID or reference for the inbound shipment.

supplierReference.description: Reference from the supplier, like a PO number or waybill.

customer.description: Name of the customer or source for the inbound shipment.

estimatedArrivalDate.description: The expected arrival date of the shipment.

items.description: A list of items included in the inbound shipment.

definition.description: Stores all outbound shipment records. The 'appId' parameter allows for namespacing data for different application instances. The 'shipmentId' is a concatenation of Source Store Order ID and Item Name. All data in this collection is publicly accessible.

params.name: appId
params.description: The application ID, used to segregate data from different application instances.

params.name: shipmentId
params.description: The unique ID of the shipment, derived from the Source Store Order ID and Item Name. This field serves as the document ID.

definition.description: Stores all inbound shipment records. The 'appId' parameter allows for namespacing data. The 'inboundId' is the client's order ID. All data is publicly accessible.

params.name: appId
params.description: The application ID for data segregation.

params.name: inboundId
params.description: The unique ID of the inbound shipment, from the client's PO or reference. This serves as the document ID.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support both outbound (Shipment) and inbound (Inbound) lookups. Data is segregated into two top-level collections under `artifacts/{appId}/public/data/`: `shipments` and `inbounds`. This separation is clean and scalable. All data is considered public for anonymous read access, simplifying security rules. Writes are restricted to authenticated users (via the app's anonymous sign-in), allowing client-side data management. The `appId` ensures multi-tenancy if needed.
